events.originalText: Myanmar civil war: Burmese military forces launched airstrikes that killed at least 80 concertgoers in Kachin State.
events.subtitle: Myanmar civil war (2021–present)
events.headline: Burmese military airstrikes kill 80 concertgoers in Kachin State

events.originalText: Hurricane Patricia, the most intense tropical cyclone on record in the Western Hemisphere, peaked with maximum sustained winds of 215 mph (345 km/h) south of Mexico.
events.subtitle: Hurricane Patricia
events.headline: Hurricane Patricia peaks with 215 mph winds south of Mexico

events.originalText: Grand Theft Auto III was released, helping to popularize open-world and mature-content video games.
events.subtitle: Grand Theft Auto III
events.headline: Grand Theft Auto III released, popularizing open-world games

events.originalText: Vietnam War: Operation Linebacker, a U.S. bombing campaign against North Vietnam in response to its Easter Offensive, ended after five months.
events.subtitle: Vietnam War
events.headline: Operation Linebacker ends after U.S. bombing campaign in Vietnam War

events.originalText: The Hungarian Revolution began as a peaceful student demonstration that attracted thousands while marching through central Budapest to the parliament building.
events.subtitle: Hungarian Revolution of 1956
events.headline: Hungarian Revolution begins with peaceful student demonstration in Budapest

events.originalText: World War II: Japanese troops began an unsuccessful attempt to recapture Henderson Field on Guadalcanal in the Solomon Islands from American forces.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Japanese troops fail to recapture Henderson Field on Guadalcanal in WWII

events.originalText: Jeannette Piccard (pictured) piloted a hot-air balloon flight that reached 57,579 feet (17,550 m), becoming the first woman to fly in the stratosphere.
events.subtitle: Jeannette Piccard
events.headline: Jeannette Piccard becomes first woman to fly in the stratosphere

events.originalText: Alberto Santos-Dumont flew his biplane 14-bis for 50 metres (160 ft) at an altitude of about four metres (13 ft).
events.subtitle: Alberto Santos-Dumont
events.headline: Alberto Santos-Dumont flies biplane 14-bis for 50 meters

events.originalText: The inaugural National Women's Rights Convention, presided over by American activist Paulina Wright Davis (pictured), began in Worcester, Massachusetts.
events.subtitle: National Women's Rights Convention
events.headline: National Women's Rights Convention begins in Worcester, Massachusetts

events.originalText: War of the Second Coalition: The Ottoman–Albanian forces of Ali Pasha of Janina defeated French troops and captured the town of Preveza at the Battle of Nicopolis.
events.subtitle: War of the Second Coalition
events.headline: Ottoman-Albanian forces defeat French troops at Battle of Nicopolis

events.originalText: Irish Catholic gentry in Ulster tried to seize control of Dublin Castle, the seat of English rule in Ireland, to force concessions to Catholics.
events.subtitle: Ulster
